message.name: RUDDER_RAW
message.description: This message encodes all of the raw rudder sensor data from the USV.
message.field: The raw data from the position sensor, generally a potentiometer.
Status of the rudder limit sensor, port side. 0 indicates off and 1 indicates that the limit is hit. If this sensor is inactive set to 0xFF.
Status of the rudder limit sensor, port side. 0 indicates off and 1 indicates that the limit is hit. If this sensor is inactive set to 0xFF.
Status of the rudder limit sensor, starboard side. 0 indicates off and 1 indicates that the limit is hit. If this sensor is inactive set to 0xFF.
Holds the raw value that indicates the port limit in ADC units. Used for mapping the raw ADC values into real units.
Holds the raw value that indicates the starboard limit in ADC units. Used for mapping the raw ADC values into real units.

message.name: WSO100
message.description: Returns the raw wind/air sensor values from the WSO100.
message.field: Wind speed in m/s.
Wind direction in rads east from north.
Air temperature in degrees Celsius.
Air pressure in Pascals.
Air humidity in %.

message.name: DST800
message.field: Water speed in m/s.
Water temperature in degrees Celsius.
Water depth in m (DST800 range is 100m). Invalid measurements are 0.0.

message.name: REVO_GS
message.description: Attitude measurements from the Revolution GS compass.
message.field: Heading in degrees eastward from north
Magnetometer status
Pitch angle in degrees.
Pitch status
Roll angle in degrees.
Roll status
Dip angle in degrees.
Horizontal component of the earth's magnetic field.

message.name: GPS200
message.description: Various interesting fields from the GPS200 CAN stream. This will likely be obsolete if/when a CAN datalogger becomes available.
message.field: Magnetic variation for the current GPS location. In units of degrees.

message.name: DSP3000
message.description: The z rotation rate as reported by the KVH DSP-3000 gyro.
message.field: Z-axis rotation rate in degrees/s, clockwise positive.

message.name: TOKIMEC
message.description: Attitude measurements from the Tokimec WSAS-2GM IMU.
message.field: Yaw angle. Units are 2e-13 rads.
Pitch angle. Units are 2e-13 rads.
Roll angle. Units are 2e-13 rads.
Angular velocity around the X-axis. Units are 2e-12 rads/s.
Angular velocity around the Y-axis. Units are 2e-12 rads/s.
Angular velocity around the Z-axis. Units are 2e-12 rads/s.
Acceleration along the X-axis. Units are 2e-8 m/s^2.
Acceleration along the Y-axis. Units are 2e-8 m/s^2.
Acceleration along the Z-axis. Units are 2e-8 m/s^2.
Magnetic bearing. Units are 2^-13 rads.
Raw GPS latitude. Units are 2e-29 rads.
Raw GPS longitude. Units are 2e-29 rads.
Estimated GPS latitude. Units are 2e-29 rads.
Estimated GPS longitude. Units are 2e-29 rads.
Raw GPS heading. Units are 2e-13 rads.
Raw GPS speed. Units are 2e-6 m/s.
Status bitfield. See Tokimec documentation.

message.name: RADIO
message.description: Status generated by radio. This is actually a message generated by the 3DR radios, and is outdated, but it's included here to assist in debugging and to prevent mavlink decoding errors.
message.field: local signal strength
remote signal strength
percentage free space in transmit buffer
background noise level
remote background noise level
receive errors
count of error corrected packets

message.name: BASIC_STATE
message.description: This message holds all values of interest for a basic analysis of the autopilot performance.
message.field: This is the rudder angle command as commanded by the onboard autonomous controller. It's in milliradians where positive indicates port-side.
This is the rudder angle command as commanded by the primary manual controller. It's in milliradians where positive indicates port-side.
This is the rudder angle command as commanded by the secondary/emergency manual controller. It's in milliradians where positive indicates port-side.
The interpreted rudder angle in radians.
This is the throttle command as commanded by the onboard autonomous controller. It's in units of 1/1023*100% of max current and positive values propel the vehicle forward.
This is the throttle command as commanded by the primary manual controller. It's in units of 1/1023*100% of max current and positive values propel the vehicle forward.
This is the throttle command as commanded by the secondary/emergency manual controller. It's in units of 1/1023*100% of max current and positive values propel the vehicle forward.
Propeller speed, positive values mean the vessel will be propelled forward. Units are in RPM.
This is the lateral acceleration as commanded by the onboard L2+ controller. Units are in m/s^2.
North-coordinate of the L2 vector in mm.
East-coordinate of the L2 vector in mm.

message.name: MAIN_POWER
message.description: Displays the voltage level and power draw of the main battery.
message.field: The current main battery rail voltage. In units of 0.01V.
The current being drawn from the main battery bank. In units of 0.1A.

message.name: NODE_STATUS
message.description: Display the status information of every node in the network.
message.field: Status bitfield for the HIL node. Consult HilNode.h for details.
Reset bitfield for the HIL node. Consult HilNode.h for details.
The onboard temperature of the HIL node in units of degrees Celsius. INT8_MAX if unmeasured/invalid.
The onboard CPU load of the HIL node in units of 1%. UINT8_MAX if unmeasured/invalid.
The onboard unregulated voltage of the HIL node in units of .1V. UINT8_MAX if unmeasured/invalid.
Status bitfield for the imu node. Consult ImuNode.h for details.
Reset bitfield for the imu node. Consult ImutNode.h for details.
The onboard temperature of the imu node in units of degrees Celsius. INT8_MAX if unmeasured/invalid.
The onboard CPU load of the imu node in units of 1%. UINT8_MAX if unmeasured/invalid.
The onboard unregulated voltage of the IMU node in units of .1V. UINT8_MAX if unmeasured/invalid.
Status bitfield for the power node. Consult PowerNode.h for details.
Reset bitfield for the power node. Consult PowerNode.h for details.
The onboard temperature of the power node in units of degrees Celsius. INT8_MAX if unmeasured/invalid.
The onboard CPU load of the power node in units of 1%. UINT8_MAX if unmeasured/invalid.
The onboard unregulated voltage of the power node in units of .1V. UINT8_MAX if unmeasured/invalid.
Status bitfield for the Primary Node. Consult PrimaryNode.h for details.
Reset bitfield for the Primary Node. Consult PrimaryNode.h for details.
The onboard temperature of the primary node in units of degrees Celsius. INT8_MAX if unmeasured/invalid.
The onboard CPU load of the primary node in units of 1%. UINT8_MAX if unmeasured/invalid.
The onboard unregulated voltage of the primary node in units of .1V. UINT8_MAX if unmeasured/invalid.
Status bitfield for the RC node. Consult RcNode.h for details.
Reset bitfield for the RC node. Consult RcNode.h for details.
The onboard temperature of the RC node in units of degrees Celsius. INT8_MAX if unmeasured/invalid.
The onboard CPU load of the RC node in units of 1%. UINT8_MAX if unmeasured/invalid.
The onboard unregulated voltage of the RC node in units of .1V. UINT8_MAX if unmeasured/invalid.
Status bitfield for the rudder node. Consult RudderNode.h for details.
Reset bitfield for the rudder node. Consult RudderNode.h for details.
The onboard temperature of the rudder node in units of degrees Celsius. INT8_MAX if unmeasured/invalid.
The onboard CPU load of the rudder node in units of 1%. UINT8_MAX if unmeasured/invalid.
The onboard unregulated voltage of the rudder node in units of .1V. UINT8_MAX if unmeasured/invalid.

message.name: WAYPOINT_STATUS
message.description: Shows the parameters for the last mission and the next mission. Useful for analyzing where the vessel should have been after a test.
message.field: The latitude of the last waypoint.
The longitude of the last waypoint.
The north component of the local coordinates of the last waypoint.
The east component of the local coordinates of the last waypoint.
The latitude of the next waypoint.
The longitude of the next waypoint.
The north component of the local coordinates of the next waypoint.
The east component of the local coordinates of the next waypoint.

message.name: BASIC_STATE2
message.description: This message holds all values of interest for a basic analysis of the autopilot performance.
message.field: This is the rudder angle command as commanded by the onboard autonomous controller. It's in milliradians where positive indicates port-side.
This is the rudder angle command as commanded by the primary manual controller. It's in milliradians where positive indicates port-side.
This is the rudder angle command as commanded by the secondary/emergency manual controller. It's in milliradians where positive indicates port-side.
This is the rudder angle command as actually output to the vessel. It's a muxed signal of the above commanded_*_rudder_angle values. It's in milliradians where positive indicates port-side.
The interpreted rudder angle in radians.
This is the throttle command as commanded by the onboard autonomous controller. It's in units of 1/1023*100% of max current and positive values propel the vehicle forward.
This is the throttle command as commanded by the primary manual controller. It's in units of 1/1023*100% of max current and positive values propel the vehicle forward.
This is the throttle command as commanded by the secondary/emergency manual controller. It's in units of 1/1023*100% of max current and positive values propel the vehicle forward.

This is the throttle command as actually output to the vessel. It's a muxed signal of the above commanded_*_throttle values. It's in units of 1/1023*100% of max current and positive values propel the vehicle forward.
Propeller speed, positive values mean the vessel will be propelled forward. Units are in RPM.
This is the lateral acceleration as commanded by the onboard L2+ controller. Units are in m/s^2.
North-coordinate of the L2 vector in mm.
East-coordinate of the L2 vector in mm.

messages.message:
The north component of the local coordinates of the last waypoint (m * 10). The east component of the local coordinates of the last waypoint (m * 10). The north component of the local coordinates of the next waypoint (m * 10). The east component of the local coordinates of the next waypoint (m * 10).
Quaternion component 1, w (1 in null-rotation) (2^15) Quaternion component 2, x (0 in null-rotation) (2^15) Quaternion component 3, y (0 in null-rotation) (2^15) Quaternion component 4, z (0 in null-rotation) (2^15) Angular velocity around the X-axis. (rads/s * 2^12) Angular velocity around the Y-axis. (rads/s * 2^12) Angular velocity around the Z-axis. (rads/s * 2^12)
Forward water speed (m/s * 1e4).
0: no fix, 1 valid fix (2D or better). Latitude (WGS84) (degrees * 1e7). If unknown, set to 0. Longitude (WGS84) (degrees * 1e7). If unknown, set to 0. GPS ground speed (m/s * 1e2). If unknown, set to 0. Course over ground, from 0 to 2*pi (rad * 1e4). If unknown, set to 0.
0 indicates system is operating normally, 1 indicates it's held in reset. Timestamp (milliseconds since system boot)
North-component of vehicle position in the local tangent plane (m * 1e3) East-component of vehicle position in the local tangent plane (m * 1e3) North-component of speed (m/s * 1e3) East-component of speed (m/s * 1e3) The yaw rate converted to the global frame (rad/s * 1e4) This is the lateral acceleration as commanded by the onboard L2+ controller (m/s^2 * 1e5) North-coordinate of the L2+ aim point (m * 10) East-coordinate of the L2+ aim point (m * 10)
This is the rudder angle command as commanded by the onboard autonomous controller, positive indicates port-side (rad * 1e4) This is the throttle command as commanded by the onboard autonomous controller. It's in units of 1/1023*100% of max current and positive values propel the vehicle forward. commanded throttle
The current rudder angle (rad * 1e4) Propeller speed, positive values mean the vessel will be propelled forward. (rpm * 100)

message.name: TOKIMEC_WITH_TIME
message.description: Attitude measurements from the Tokimec WSAS-2GM IMU (timestamped).
message.field: Timestamp (milliseconds since system boot)
Yaw angle. Units are 2e-13 rads.
Pitch angle. Units are 2e-13 rads.
Roll angle. Units are 2e-13 rads.
Angular velocity around the X-axis. Units are 2e-12 rads/s.
Angular velocity around the Y-axis. Units are 2e-12 rads/s.
Angular velocity around the Z-axis. Units are 2e-12 rads/s.
Acceleration along the X-axis. Units are 2e-8 m/s^2.
Acceleration along the Y-axis. Units are 2e-8 m/s^2.
Acceleration along the Z-axis. Units are 2e-8 m/s^2.
Magnetic bearing. Units are 2^-13 rads.
Raw GPS latitude. Units are 2e-29 rads.
Raw GPS longitude. Units are 2e-29 rads.
Estimated GPS latitude. Units are 2e-29 rads.
Estimated GPS longitude. Units are 2e-29 rads.
Raw GPS heading. Units are 2e-13 rads.
Raw GPS speed. Units are 2e-6 m/s.
Status bitfield. See Tokimec documentation.

message.name: PARAM_VALUE_WITH_TIME
message.description: Emit the value of an onboard parameter. The inclusion of param_count and param_index in the message allows the recipient to keep track of received parameters and allows him to re-request missing parameters after a loss or timeout.
message.field: Timestamp (milliseconds since system boot)

Onboard parameter id, terminated by NULL if the length is less than 16 human-readable chars and WITHOUT null termination (NULL) byte if the length is exactly 16 chars - applications have to provide 16+1 bytes storage if the ID is stored as string
Onboard parameter value
Onboard parameter type: see the MAV_PARAM_TYPE enum for supported data types.
Total number of onboard parameters
Index of this onboard parameter
